about.title: Who We Are
about.subtitle: Rooted in history, relevant for today.
about.confession_text: We fully subscribe to the <1>1689 London Baptist Confession of Faith</1>. We believe it is the best summary of what the Bible teaches.
about.total_depravity_desc: Man is completely dead in sin and unable to save himself.
about.unconditional_election_desc: God chose His people before the foundation of the world, not based on any foreseen merit.
about.limited_atonement_desc: Christ died specifically and effectually for the elect, securing their salvation.
about.irresistible_grace_desc: The Holy Spirit effectually calls the elect to faith, overcoming their resistance.
about.perseverance_saints_desc: Those whom God has chosen and Christ has redeemed will remain in faith until the end.
about.sola_scriptura_desc: The Scriptures are the only sufficient, certain, and infallible rule of all saving knowledge, faith, and obedience.
about.sovereign_grace_desc: Salvation is entirely of God's grace, not human merit.
about.believers_baptism_desc: Baptism is for those who profess repentance towards God and faith in our Lord Jesus Christ.
about.regulative_principle_desc: We worship God only as He has commanded in Scripture.
about.local_membership_desc: Meaningful accountability and love among members.
about.elder_desc: Faithfully serving HRBC since 20XX. Committed to shepherding the flock with instructions from the Word.
about.deacon_desc: Serving the physical needs of the body and maintaining the church property.
about.history_text: Hawassa Reformed Baptist Church was planted in [Year] with a burden to see a biblical church established in this city. Starting as a small Bible study in a living room, God has faithfully grown us into a congregation that loves His Word. We continue to look forward to how God will use us to spread the Gospel in Hawassa and beyond.

statement_of_faith.title: What We Believe
statement_of_faith.reformed_text: We are committed to the historic Christian faith, rooted in the Scriptures and summarized in the 1689 London Baptist Confession of Faith. This confession, along with the Baptist Catechism, serves as a faithful guide to understanding and applying God’s Word. We believe the Bible is the inspired, inerrant, and authoritative Word of God, and it is our final authority for all matters of faith and life.
statement_of_faith.scriptures_desc: We believe the Bible (Old and New Testaments) is the verbally inspired Word of God, without error in the original writings, and is the complete revelation of His will for salvation and life. It is our supreme authority. (2 Timothy 3:16-17; 2 Peter 1:20-21)
statement_of_faith.trinity_desc: We believe in one God, eternally existing in three co-equal persons: Father, Son (Jesus Christ), and Holy Spirit. They are one God, having the same divine nature, attributes, and perfection. (Matthew 28:19; 2 Corinthians 13:14)
statement_of_faith.god_father_desc: We believe in God the Father, an infinite, personal Spirit, perfect in holiness, wisdom, power, and love. He concerns Himself mercifully in the affairs of men, He hears and answers prayer, and He saves from sin and death all who come to Him through Jesus Christ.
statement_of_faith.jesus_christ_desc: We believe that Jesus Christ is the eternal Son of God, fully God and fully man, conceived by the Holy Spirit and born of the Virgin Mary. He lived a sinless life, died on the cross as a substitutionary atonement for our sins, rose bodily from the dead, ascended to heaven, and will return again in glory. (John 1:1, 14; Philippians 2:5-11)
statement_of_faith.holy_spirit_desc: We believe in the Holy Spirit, the third person of the Trinity, who convicts the world of sin, regenerates those who believe, indwells, empowers, and guides believers into all truth. (John 16:7-15; Titus 3:5)
statement_of_faith.humanity_desc: We believe that God created man and woman in His own image, but they fell into sin through disobedience. As a result, all humanity is born with a sin nature, is alienated from God, and is under His just condemnation. (Genesis 1:26-27; Romans 3:23)

biblical_basis.title: Why We Give
biblical_basis.intro: Giving is an act of worship, an expression of gratitude for God's grace, and a participation in the mission of the church. We give not out of compulsion, but cheerfully, knowing that God loves a cheerful giver.
biblical_basis.stewardship_desc: We recognize that everything we have belongs to God. We are merely stewards of His resources, called to use them faithfully for His glory.
biblical_basis.generosity_desc: Our giving is motivated by the gospel. For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though he was rich, yet for your sake he became poor, so that you by his poverty might become rich. (2 Corinthians 8:9)
